subject: Cooking
title: Chocolate: From Aztec Ritual to Global Treat
description: A short lesson to help you apply Chocolate: From Aztec Ritual to Global Treat.

hook.text: The Aztecs drank chocolate as a bitter, spicy ceremonial beverage. Adding sugar changed everything.

buildup.text: Cacao beans were so valued in Mesoamerica that they served as currency â€” 100 beans bought a turkey.

discovery.text: Spanish conquistadors brought cacao to Europe in the 1520s and added sugar to make it palatable.

twist.text: For 300 years, chocolate was only a drink. The solid chocolate bar wasn't invented until 1847.

climax.text: Swiss innovation added milk and conching, creating the smooth, sweet chocolate we know today.

punchline.text: Chocolate spent millennia as a bitter drink before becoming candy.

quiz.question: How did the Aztecs primarily consume chocolate?
